campaign.story:
Enter a world of high fantasy where both gods and mortals war against the binding threads of fate. 
Venture Maidens is a 5th Edition roleplaying setting born from the actual-play podcast of the same name, which five femmes bring to life every week for thousands of listeners. Our world is riddled with machinations of the powerful and plagued by ancient forces ready to devour the unwary, where only adventurers who possess an unshakeable will can hope to forge their own path. Are you prepared to take up the challenge and fight for your destiny?
Venture Maidens Campaign Guide Cover Art by Kii Weatherton
Venture Maidens Campaign Guide interior design & formatting by BNE Design
Inside this promo, you will find previews of the material from the Venture Maidens campaign book for both players and DMs. Discover one of the twelve new subclasses inspired by the Venture Maidens’ world: a warlock granted powers of creation by a progenitor titan. You will also get a sneak peek at our unique new Heroic Destiny system, giving DMs the tools to craft meaningful story arcs tailored to your players’ characters. Click here to download the promo now!
Download the Venture Maidens Campaign Guide promo now!
At the heart of Venture Maidens is a homebrew 5th Edition campaign brought to life as a bi-weekly live stream and podcast. Five years ago, a group of lifelong friends came together to fumble their way through tech troubles to produce a show that now boasts millions of downloads and thousands of listeners across the globe. However, somewhere along the way, Venture Maidens became so much bigger than just one show. The venturers are a passionate gaming community who champion friendship and creativity in all things. The stories we tell both on and off the table are fun, fearless, and unapologetically human. Learn more about the show on their website here.
Learn more about the Venture Maidens!

Celeste Conowitch is a game designer based out of the Pacific Northwest. She is the producer, DM, and editor of the actual-play podcast Venture Maidens. When not plotting behind the screen, you can catch her championing femme lead shows as co-founder of the Penwitch Studio podcast network. She works as a full-time designer at 2CGaming and has freelanced with companies like Wizards of the Coast, Kobold Press, and MCDM Productions. To keep up with Celeste, follow her on Twitter @cconowitch.

Willy Abeel's a gonzo game designer who tends to toy with weird worlds and mechanical miscellanea. They developed Jumping On Mounted Combat for MCDM’s Arcadia magazine and introduced clown people to D&D on The Book of House for some unexplained reason. You can usually find the Willyboo, @TheWillyboo, funposting online and having a good time over on Twitter.
Katie Budabin plays Fera Velen on the Venture Maidens podcast. Ever since that first YA fantasy novel, she began looking for creative outlets and found herself in the Dungeons & Dragons community. When she’s not playing a tiefling sorceress, she can be found making D&D-inspired pins and jewelry on her Etsy store. For more info you can find her on Twitter @lazy_mermaiden.

Naseem Etemad is an actor and stylist as well as a lifelong gamer, playing in the Venture Maidens podcast as the big-hearted human monk, Sawyeh Noor, since the podcast’s launch. She also operates the Venture Maidens social channels as the show’s social media manager. Find her on socials @nas_ghoul if you are interested in keeping up with her streaming schedule and other professional work.
Mike Evans is a reluctant wrangler of the darkest demon known to the living: Adobe. He designs and animates tirelessly in a futile attempt to save this plane from the undead hordes of poor typography. When not shouting at his computer, Mike creates artifacts to imprison the world’s evils over at TheImperialForge.com.
Kat Kruger is a best-selling freelance game designer at her owner-operated company, Steampunk Unicorn Studio. Her previous projects include: HeroQuest, Betrayal at Baldur’s Gate, and various D&D adventures. In the TTRPG sphere she has most notably contributed to the inaugural Uncaged Anthology and Eyes Unclouded. She is also the Dungeon Master on the family-friendly, actual-play podcast d20 Dames. When she’s not writing or editing games, she’s raising a geeky toddler with her partner and their dachshund in Seattle. To keep up with Kat, follow her on Twitter @KatKruger.
After studying game design and software programming, JB Little discovered an aptitude and love of writing and literature that secured his bachelor’s degree in English. After four years in the hobby of tabletop gaming, he released his first product on the DMs Guild for Dungeons and Dragons 5th Edition and, in the fall of 2018, transitioned into the role of full-time content creation for tabletop RPGs. He’s since released 28 bestselling titles and worked with numerous companies such as Absolute Tabletop, Action Fiction, Amarune’s Almanac Team, Kobold Press, Grim Press, Jeff C. Stevens, and Vorpal Press. You can follow him on Twitter @DropTheDie.
Brittany Quintero is a tattoo artist and gamer who brings Arrnodel Ithil the moon elf warlock to life each week on the Venture Maidens podcast. Visual art is one and the same as the art of magic to Brittany, so she usually plays a magic-user. By day, Brittany weaves her own magic into her work as a tattoo artist, illustrating stories and meanings by her clients’ request. Like a warlock, she earned her powers through a lifetime of practice and an apprenticeship from an all-knowing mentor. To keep up with Brittany, find her on Instagram @vizualwarlock.
Sage Stafford is both a player and showrunner for the Venture Maidens. When they’re not playing their favorite barbarian cleric combo Kara Brynehilde, they love running modules on the Venture Maidens Twitch channel. When they’re not playing Dungeons and Dragons, you can find them talking Magic: the Gathering on their “Sage of Fables” YouTube channel. Follow Sage @StaffOfSage to see what they’re up to every week.
Ryan Servis serves the dual role of Lead Designer and Writing Director at 2CGaming, ensuring the writing quality and game design are always improving and achieving a diverse array of high-quality projects. You can herald his coming or issue a challenge at www.2cgaming.com or twitter @2cgaming.

2CGaming has run professional and personal games and produced tabletop gaming supplements for 5th Edition D&D and the Pathfinder RPG since 2014. We’ve a long list of completed projects, many of which are detailed below and are available at store.2cgaming.com! Not only do we have a history of delivering on our promises, we have received critical acclaim for our books, which stand out for their content and production quality.

Risks and challenges
2CGaming has been producing content through Kickstarter for years. We have a proven track record of high-quality, consistent delivery of incredible 5th Edition supplements funded through your generous and continued support.

While we have several outstanding Kickstarter projects in development, these are rapidly concluding, and we’ve been providing regular updates on consistent, measurable progress on each. We expect to close out several of these shortly (Dragonflight and Epic Legacy Tome of Titans) and have limited overlap between the teams as many of each are long-time contractors.

As always please reach out with any questions or concerns. We are continuously striving to improve our processes and customer assistance, and we thank you for your ongoing support, patience, and enthusiasm.

updates.update_content:
Hope everyone is doing great! We're very excited to share some quick updates on the Venture Maidens Campaign Guide!

Art & Writing
And we're off! The writing team is already putting pen to paper or fingers to keyboards, and the art for the project is scoped and starting to get underway. Celeste is getting the administrative and management infrastructure in place to organize all the moving parts and things are moving smoothly, and as anticipated. We can't wait to show you some art & writing progress as soon as we have something! Going to be great.

Thank you so much for all the support on the Venture Maidens Campaign Guide! We are so, so thrilled for the amazing support and are extremely excited to leap into development! There are a few housekeeping items we'd like to run by all you lovely people, so we'll keep this update short and to the point!

Next Steps

Assemble your party—we’re in for a world of adventure!
You’ve done it! As our Kickstarter draws ever closer to a close, you all have come through to hit that 100k mark! This means that all you wonderful backers who purchased the Hell’s Bells Adventure Zine (or a collector’s box) will get three additional adventure zines! We are thrilled to give you all the tools to play a level 1 through 20 adventure highlighting the best our setting has to offer. And if you haven’t grabbed the Hell’s Bells Adventure Zine yet, now is the time to upgrade your pledge, because four adventures for the price of one is a deal you don’t want to miss!

updates.update_userinfo: Last Week - New Promo - Blossom Court
updates.update_content:
What’s this? A sweet-smelling new promo has dropped!
Hey, venturers! Since you all have been so amazing through this Kickstarter, we’ve decided to share another promo with you! Click here to download the Blossom Court promo (or grab it from the Kickstarter page!), which gives you a peek at the Sovereign Fey Court lore we’re writing for the book. Not only does this promo reveal some juicy world secrets, it also gives you a first look at the monster templates we’re including so you can upgrade any existing creature with the powers of the plant-themed Blossom Court. Check it out, and give us a shout on social media to let us know your thoughts! Can’t wait to message you again when we hit that next stretch goal.

It’s time to get fancy, because we’ve unlocked our fourth stretch goal!
It’s raining gold! Since we hit the 70k mark, our book is receiving a masterwork printing upgrade. That means we’re adding gold foil to the cover, adding a midnight-purple bookmark, using higher-quality paper, and grabbing the highest quality stitching we can get. Our book is now the best it can possibly be both inside and out, all thanks to your generous support! Now we can turn our sights to additional tools to help you explore the world of Venture Maidens.

Good news, everyone—we’ve added more Collector’s Boxes!
Hello, champions. We’ve got some exciting news! We’re doing an additional run of Collector’s Boxes! Since our first set of Collector’s Boxes sold out so quickly, we’ve put our resources together to conjure another 50 boxes available at the $250 level. This second round of boxes will take us a little longer to produce, so if you order one now (or upgrade your pledge) you will receive the box in September 2022 as opposed to June 2022. This extra time frame is necessary to accommodate the production of all the extra goodies that go inside the box. So, if you missed that first run, now is your chance! Make sure to hurry though, because they are already flying off the (virtual) shelves. We are so thrilled that we can make this happen for you wonderful people, because you deserve all the best for making our dreams come true.
What’s that we hear? It’s the sound of our fourth stretch goal unlocking!

Our 48-hour promotion has ended, but the add-on fun is just beginning!
You have floored us with your support during the last two days, but the campaign is still heating up! Our 48-hour promotion to get a free enamel pin or adventure zine is officially over, but never fear–you can still grab these items as add-ons through the end of the campaign. At any time, you can choose to upgrade your pledge to include any (or all) of the excellent add-on items posted on the page. That means you can grab that gorgeous enamel pin of fate, the “Hell’s Bells” adventure zine, or a stunning set of handmade polyhedral dice with the Venture Maidens logo up through the end of the campaign, and afterwards through the pledge manager!
Prepare for trouble—we’ve unlocked our third stretch goal!

campaign.story:
In the myriad realms of imagination, there are many dungeons to explore, dragons to tame, and paths to find. Anime 5E helps you unlock the realms of fantasy to experience them all.
Welcome to Anime 5E – the fantasy role-playing game for all your anime and manga adventures, which builds upon the Fifth Edition rules of the world’s most popular storytelling game. Mark MacKinnon, creator of the critically acclaimed Big Eyes, Small Mouth anime role-playing game, brings a point-based balance to the standard Fifth Edition offerings – and then layers a wide selection of new Races, Classes, Skills, features, powers, game mechanics, and combat options on top of this foundation. Anime 5E is the beginning of a journey, so hold on tight as we welcome you to your next great fantasy adventure!
Join the growing Anime 5E RPG community group on Facebook!
Anime 5E RPG Core Rules
Published under the Open Game License, this single Anime 5E core role-playing game book contains everything you need to start creating and playing anime and manga RPG adventures. It works as an excellent expansion and companion to other Fifth Edition books as well, offering a unique perspective on traditional fantasy tabletop gaming. Whether you run with Anime 5E by itself or integrate it with other 5E resources, you'll be well prepared to unleash dynamic and dramatic action at your gaming table!
This gorgeous volume offers a solid 272 full-colour pages with over 100 beautiful illustrations from talented artist across the world. Anime 5E features a laminated hardcover with a durable Smyth-sewn binding that allows your book to easily lay flat and stay open to any page.
Inside the pages of Anime 5E, you'll find:
A flexible, point-based approach to character features that lets you acquire the specific elements you envision for your character
14 new races that cover a wide range of anime archetypes
Guidelines and rules for playing characters other then medium-size
14 new classes that offer incredible diversity in abilities and talents
Rebalanced standard Fifth Edition classes to level out character abilities
70 wide-ranging character features (called Attributes), each with multiple ranks that expand their scope and utility
36 character flaws (called Defects) that return points to your character so they can power up in different ways to compensate
50 skill proficiencies that build upon the original Fifth Edition offerings and expand into numerous non-combat scenarios, talents, and trades
A veritable treasure trove of combat enhancements and options, including called shots, critical hits and failures, tactical actions, range penalties, dramatic feats, and more
An innovative approach to calculating the Challenge Rating of monsters that considers their full range of features, abilities, and talents – both in and out of combat
Dozens of example adventuring gear, items of power, and fascinating daily devices
Rebuilds of 14 standard fantasy monsters across the Challenge Rating spectrum
Check out the gorgeous and evocative wrap-around cover by the talented Chabibit, and then click to download the Anime 5E table of contents so you can preview what's inside.
Anime 5E Deluxe Limited Edition Core RPG
Dedicated anime gamers and Fifth Edition role-playing aficionados won't want to miss out on this stunning version of the game: the Anime 5E Limited Edition Core RPG. The Anime 5E logo is stamped in silver foil onto a rich black leatherette cover, the pages are accented with silver gilded edges, and the binding is enhanced with a handy bookmark ribbon to keep your place while playing. Otherwise, the interior contents are the same as the regular Anime 5E edition.
The Anime 5E Deluxe Limited Edition Core RPG will normally not be purchasable in retail stores and is available exclusively during this Kickstarter. We are only printing a limited number of this edition, with a small number of extra copies to anticipate late pledge manager add-ons. Should any copies remain after the Kickstarter is fulfilled, we will only offer them at conventions and through direct web store sales while quantities last.
Anime 5E RPG Core Rules – Pocket Edition
The Anime 5E Pocket Edition is the ideal entry point into the game for backers who are looking for a smaller, portable book format at half the price of the standard full-colour hardcover edition. Printed in the familiar manga-sized dimensions on a textured uncoated paper stock with paperback cover, the Anime 5E Pocket Edition weighs in at a hefty 384 black-and-white pages. Most of the content from the regular hardcover edition is included in this alternate format – including all rules, races, and classes, and monsters – using a slightly smaller font size and fewer illustrations. Chapter 12 (plus two brief designer note appendicies) from the regular edition, which provides player and DM guidance, has been omitted to keep the page count (and thus cost) lower. Use the Anime 5E Pocket Edition solo as your primary game book, or as an additional inexpensive reference copy for your gaming table.
Anime 5E Game Screen and Adventure
This handy, 4-panel reference screen for Masters of the Dungeon features a one-stop location for important Anime 5E tables, wrapped in a stunning full-colour panoramic image on the front that expands the dragon lair Anime 5E cover image scene with additional characters and monsters. As a bonus, inside you’ll find "Carry on Wayward Son" – an engaging 32-page introductory fantasy adventure for 2nd-4th level characters, written by Andrew J Lucas. The adventure incorporates aspects of a traditional dungeon crawl with pet monster tournament battles, familial intrigue, and political machinations.
With gorgeous art and an intriguing story narrative, this Anime 5E Game Screen and Adventure is a must-have addition to your Fifth Edition anime RPG collection.
Anime 5E Character Folio
Some players desire more than a simple character sheet to present their creation. The Anime 5E Character Folio is the ultimate journal for detailing characters from any style of game campaign. The 24-page folio includes: a deluxe character sheet with expanded areas for abilities and descriptions; sections for detailing your character’s features, talents, weapons, flaws, spells, items, companions, vehicles, treasure, dice situations, background, family, goals, and personality; and journal pages on which you can record your character’s profile, inner thoughts, group dynamics, secrets learned during each session, and other important game notes. The bonus free PDF version included with the print edition includes fillable text entries as well.
You can customise your Anime 5E Kickstarter pledge to your exact specifications by selecting the reward level that most closely matches what you want to receive, and then selecting additional add-ons from the pop-up list of options presented with your pledge level. For example, to add the $25 Anime 5E RPG Pocket Edition to your $50 Gamer Pledge, simply choose the Gamer level and then click the add button for the Pocket Edition. It's that easy! And of course, add-on funds unrelated to shipping count towards qualifying stretch goal pledges as well (so a $50 Gamer Pledge + two $25 Pocket Edition add ons counts as a $100 pledge for stretch goal qualifications). 
If necessary, you'll later identify any additional funds added to your campaign once we send you the link to our BackerKit survey in April a couple of weeks after the Kickstarter has ended. Note that adding on extra items to your pledge may increase your shipping costs, as indicated in the section below.
All funds that you add on NOW during the Kickstarter will contribute towards the campaign's stretch goals – but not add-ons made after the campaign ends during the BackerKit! – so be sure you top up your pledge TODAY to create the right package of products for you instead of waiting.
You'll get exclusive early access to the digital PDFs in your pledge level when the physical books are sent to press in May 2021. We'll use industry leader, DriveThruRPG.com, to deliver all PDF content. For physical copies, we will calculate and charge shipping separately later through BackerKit to provide the best possible rates for your rewards and add-ons.
Adding physical rewards to digital-only pledge levels will incur shipping fees with a minimum charge equal to the most similar physical pledge level. In unique situations where you add physical rewards to digital-only pledge levels and BackerKit undercharges you for the shipping cost, an additional freight fee will be billed through Paypal before shipping. If you have questions about these shipping fees, please email info@dyskami.ca.
Shipping costs are included in the table below based on the provided pledge levels. Add-ons with your pledge may increase your shipping costs, as indicated in the chart. Of course, shipping cost do not count towards qualify pledge amounts for stretch goal considerations (for example, a stretch goal requiring a $100 qualifying pledge cannot include shipping costs in the amount needed to reach $100).
Please note that physical rewards for this Kickstarter are unavailable to ship to the following countries: Brazil, Russia, Ukraine, Kazakhstan, and Afghanistan.
There are many excellent reason to make a pledge during this Kickstarter campaign, and we want to make the decision easy for you.
Every pledge for physical book copies also comes with FREE copies of their PDFs from DriveThruRPG as well, which are delivered promptly in May after the Kickstarter ends and you finalise your pledge – and that adds up to a huge savings!
Since PDFs of the new releases won't be made available on DriveThruRPG until June/July – and you'll receive your files in May – you'll get a month of exclusive early access to the PDFs for your pledge!
For physical books, we ship to our Kickstarter backers as soon as the freight arrives in our warehouse – well before the distribution chain receives their copies. This means you'll have your copies up to one to two months before they are available in stores! 
Your pledge funds contribute towards unlocking valuable stretch goals during the campaign that allows us to give you even more Anime 5E awesomeness!
Finally, funds from pledges like yours that push the campaign above the minimum threshold go directly to advancing work on a potential Anime 5E game line. This means we can reprioritise our work schedule, and allocate more resources towards creating and improving amazing future products at Dyskami.
This direct-to-consumers Kickstarter is a vital component for launching an Anime 5E line and distributing it worldwide. Dyskami Publishing and Japanime Games strongly supports the efforts of independent game retailers as well, and has created a $2 retailer-only pledge level for verifiable brick-and-mortar stores. This pledge locks in your store's access to all physical product available in the Kickstarter, including all add-ons. No further payment is due at this time. We will reach out and work you with you to complete your order in May, so your store will gain early access to the products and stretch goals before they are available through distribution. Please contact us directly (info@dyskami.ca) for more information how we can work together to help support the Anime 5E line at your store.
Dyskami Publishing Company is a tabletop game designer and publisher headquartered in Guelph, Ontario, Canada. Dyskami's founder and award-winning game designer, Mark MacKinnon, serves as the lead designer for the Anime 5E line. In addition to relaunching anime role-playing game lines, Dyskami Publishing also designs a licensed line of tabletop games featuring the popular Japanese anime series, Sailor Moon Crystal. For more information about Dyskami Publishing, visit their website at dyskami.ca.
Japanime Games is dedicated to bringing you the finest games from Japan and beyond! It's our goal to import and translate the best games from Asia to bring those great games to a wider audience. Our games feature some of the finest art that can be found along with engaging gameplay and quality components. We are committed to great customer service and have hundreds of thousands of happy customers. For more information about Japanime Games, visit their website at japanimegames.com.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Dyskami Publishing Company and our publishing partner, Japanime Games, has extensive experience managing and fulfilling Kickstarters. Our companies have done this before and have done it exceptionally well.

This Anime 5E project is managed by creatives and entrepreneurs who have many years of experience with the hobby gaming industry. Additionally, the game design, illustrations, writing, and graphic production for all products is complete and final editing is underway. Consequently, with our extensive planning and management protocols in place, we believe that the risks and challenges are minimal for this project. Unanticipated COVID-19 pandemic restrictions may result in some delay, though we hope that worldwide vaccination initiatives help control this unpredictable element.

As always, our goal is to ensure our Kickstarter backers are the first to receive their pledged game rewards. We will post campaign updates regularly from the end of the Kickstarter until we have fulfilled your pledges. After the campaign, we offer a no-questions-asked refund on your pledge (minus the non-refundable Kickstarter and payment processing fees that we cannot recover) until we have closed our BackerKit. Refunds are either processed via PayPal or through an alternate convenient method, at our discretion.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Across Charted Space and throughout other universes, mercenaries are recruited to fight the wars of others, taking great risks to gain great rewards.
With the Mercenary box set, you will be able to have your Travellers recruit and equip their own mercenary unit, from a single squad to a massive battalion, and take on the most lucrative contracts as they fight their way across the stars. Your mercenaries will be able to pick up tickets that will see them engage in counterinsurgencies, strike operations, train resistance fighters in the wilds, police unruly populations, and take on the heaviest warfighting jobs available.
Everything is provided in the set for you to do this, from the initial creation of the mercenary unit to the building of tickets for your Travellers to attempt, with specialised units and equipment enhance a unit's capabilities, and enough adventuring material to kickstart any new campaign.
What is Inside?
The Mercenary set will initially contain three books in a box set, but stretch goals will unlock additional hardbacks and adventures to expand the mercenary experience, covering new tickets, equipment and rival units.
Book 1: Mercenaries in the Far Future
Book 2: Running a Mercenary Force
Book 3: In the Field
Wipeable Unit Roster Card
The writing for the Mercenary box set is complete and you can download the first book included in the set, Mercenaries in the Far Future, right HERE.

Mercenaries in the Far Future: A full guide on using mercenary units in Traveller, detailing how they operate and fight across a range of environments and Tech Levels, along with rules on how to resolve missions and related incidents in the life of mercenaries. It also deals with larger-scale conflicts and how the focus can shift from a high-level picture of a theatre of war to a crisis point involving a handful of mercenaries. In short, this volume is all about what an existing mercenary unit does.
Running a Mercenary Force: This book shows you how a mercenary force is recruited, maintained, expanded and subdivided if necessary. Four key resources are necessary to this process: Personnel, Credits, Materiel and Influence.
In the Field: The tickets presented in this volume are intended for use in any Traveller campaign, and are independent of Charted Space and the Third Imperium universe. Some are standalone incidents which can be placed in any suitable location, whilst others form part of a wider conflict or confrontation. In addition to the tickets presented here these situations provide a backdrop for further mercenary operations and adventures.
Why Kickstarter?
The Mercenary box set brings a new style of campaign to Traveller and contains all the core rules needed to make warfighting a way of life for your group. However, there is no one set way to build a new mercenary unit and each is as unique as the group of Travellers behind it. Clearly, there is an immense amount of ground that can be covered, from new 'toys' to equip your soldiers with to specialist mercenary units and fully fleshed out tickets to kick your campaigns off. Kickstarter gives us the very best opportunity to explore these avenues while constantly getting your feedback on how to present them.

Pledge Levels
There are just three main pledge levels (Virtual Mercenary, Mercenary Soldier, Mercenary Officer) in this Kickstarter project - select the one that appeals to you most and we will soon have Mercenary in your hands.
The Field Commander's Pack
Prospective recruits will be able to purchase a special orientation pack to get them grounded in mercenary life and on their way to earning a fortune - and now you can too, simply by choosing to pledge at the Mercenary Officer level!
In the Field Commander's Pack, you will find:
A pad of blank Mercenary Unit Roster sheets, ready for your new unit
Six Mercenary pencils, perfect for your Travellers
One Mercenary Officer's pen, because referees are worth it
The Enemy Vehicle Recognition Pack, 24 postcard-sized aids picturing and detailing the most dangerous vehicles you are likely to meet on the battlefield - and should be on your unit's shopping list
A boxed set of 20 brand new Mercenary dice
The Premium Weapons Guide, a 16 page addition to the Field Catalogue featuring items made available only to the finest of mercenary units
All in an official and attractive presentation pack (if you are a Traveller collector, you will not want to miss this one!)

Stretch Goals
We have lots planned for your Mercenary campaign and, with your kind help and support, we hope we can give you a lot more bang for your pledge!




Traveller Packages
During past Traveller Kickstarter projects, we offered various existing Traveller books so backers could fill the gaps in their collections. The Traveller range is growing quite nicely, and so we have put together a range of Traveller Packages that will allow you to add to your pledge and get these books as soon as the Kickstarter is complete (no waiting around for Mercenary to be printed!).
Simply choose which packages you are after and add their cost to your current pledge level. After the Kickstarter is complete, you will receive a survey asking you to confirm which packages you added, and we will send you these books within the next four weeks, along with their PDFs!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have always delivered on our Kickstarter projects and if you were to ask one of our previous backers of previous Traveller projects such as The Great Rift, the Element Class Cruiser Blueprints or Deepnight Revelation, we believe you would hear that the quality of our Kickstarter projects is always worth it, and you tend to end up with more than you originally pledged for!

That said, we have taken steps to ensure Mercenary does not overrun its projected completion date.

For a start, much of the work has already been done on the box set, and the first book has already entered the art and layout process - you can freely download what has been completed thus far for free using the link in the description above.

Second, we have brought in fan favourite Martin J Dougherty, to pen the set. Traveller veterans will know the reputation of Mr Dougherty well, as he is a true professional and one of the most reliable writers Mongoose has ever worked with in our near 20 years of business - backers of the Great Rift, Element Cruisers and Deepnight Revelation Kickstarter projects saw that he delivered manuscripts on time, and they were most excellent!

We will be showcasing previews of Mercenary throughout this Kickstarter to demonstrate just what we are working on, how we are progressing, and to gauge your opinion on the articles.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Good afternoon, fellow Travellers!
Well, we are a little late on this update, I do apologise - the world is not the most awesome place at the moment for RPG publishers with delays springing up everywhere (and none so much as with international shipping, though that will not affect Mercenary for a little while yet).
Anyway... as I type this, the Field Catalogue is being uploaded to Drivethru and if you redownload the Mercenary Kickstarter files you should find it added to the list!

Good morning, fellow Travellers!
Just a quick update on where we are at the moment.
Well... we are running a little behind, but we have things in place to begin catching up:@
Field Catalogue: We were hoping to get the first layout of this to you today, but it is quite a 'technical' book that is requiring a few more hours. However, we should have this with you around the middle of next week.

Good afternoon, fellow Travellers!
You should be getting some more goodies by PDF later this month but, in the meantime, I thought you might like to see the contents of the next hardback, Specialist Forces. This is, as they say, a good 'un. In fact, for certain Travellers, I think it might become a 'required' book as it contains way more than just how to build a specialist mercenary force. There is a lot in here that will relevant to many 'standard' Traveller campaigns...

Good morning, fellow Travellers!
Just a quick update at the start of May to let you know where everything is with Mercenary.
We are running a tad behind schedule at the moment, but not massively so and it is all going towards improving the final books.

Box Set Update

Good afternoon, fellow Travellers!
A quick update for you all to let you know where we are with things...

Package Shipping

Good morning, fellow Travellers!
Just a quickie update on the progress of all the additional packages that were pledged for (such as the Starship Captains and JTAS packages).
US and Canadian packages are being processed right now and will be en route imminently.

Good afternoon, fellow Travellers!
Okay, some good news - Kickstarter have come through with your details (and, incidentally, the funds which is, you know, helpful...) so we can now start processing everything.
Now, while we had originally planned to be sending the existing packages out to those who pledged them by now, we have literally just got hold of all the files from Kickstarter which need processing into something our systems can understand and, of course, this is a 'short' week here in the UK. All of this means that it is likely to be next week before we really get into sending those out in large numbers. However, we will see what we can do in the remaining days of this week!

Good morning, fellow Travellers!
Quick update. By now, we had expected to get the PDFs of the books of the Mercenary box set to you all. However, Kickstarter has yet to let us know exactly who you are!
Normally, Kickstarter is very good at this and we expected to have everything in hand on Tuesday morning. However, as of yesterday, not a dicky bird.

Good morning, fellow Travellers!
Well, you have all done it again - the Mercenary Kickstarter is fully funded, with all book stretch goals met and exceeded. We fell just shy of the very last stretch goal, but we will be sorting out a smaller bonus for the graphical staff at Mongoose and writer Martin regardless.
Well done, everyone and thank you for your faith and trust! We will now be beavering away to get everything ready for you, aiming for shipping towards the end of the year.

campaign.story:
Forge your legacy in the award-winning setting of the Iron Kingdoms with the celebrated 5th edition roleplaying game rules.
For more news on Iron Kingdoms: Requiem, or if you're coming to the project after it has already closed, sign up for our mailing list where you'll be on the cutting edge of all developments for the IK!
(Delivering September 2021)
Embark upon a journey of adventure and intrigue in a world where steam power and gunpowder meet sword and sorcery. Armed with mechanika and accompanied by mighty steamjacks, explore the soot-covered cities of the Iron Kingdoms and the aftermath of the otherworldly invasion of the infernals.
Take on the persona of unique character classes, like the gun mage, who combines powerful magic with a deadly acumen for firearms, or the steamjack-commanding warcaster, who can command 10-ton autonomous machines of war with just a thought. Explore a fantastic world rebuilding itself after an apocalypse as it marches onward with its industrial revolution.
The Iron Kingdoms possess a rich history—and a tumultuous future—full of unique monsters, deities, heroes, and villains.
More than a thousand years ago, the land that is now called the Iron Kingdoms was western Immoren, a mire of warring human city-states. Then came the Orgoth, conquest-driven imperialists from beyond the sea who laid low the cities of man with forbidden magic and changed the face of western Immoren forever. The Orgoth Empire occupied the land for six hundred years before the people of Immoren banded together to defeat the invaders and drive them back across the sea from whence they came. While the rebel armies kept the peace, their leaders convened in a city called Corvis. This Council of Ten drafted the Corvis Treaties after weeks of furious debate, and the Iron Kingdoms were born.
Strictly speaking, the term “Iron Kingdoms” refers to the lands of humanity, those five kingdoms that signed the Corvis Treaties: Cygnar, Khador, Llael, Ord, and the Protectorate of Menoth. Other nations of western Immoren are commonly included in that description, although they took no part in the treaties. In the frigid north is the dwarven kingdom of Rhul. To the northeast lies the mysterious homeland of the elves, Ios. The last kingdom informally included when speaking of the “Iron Kingdoms” is the hostile island nation of Cryx, ruled over by Lord Toruk, the Dragonfather. All these nations—and many more—share the continent of Immoren.
The Orgoth were driven from western Immoren more than four hundred years ago, but the decisions made during the rebellion still echo through the world. There are many strange legends from the last days of that war—tales of dark, mysterious allies who helped drive off the invaders. Some say it would have been impossible to defeat the Orgoth without this help, that the rebel leaders had to make dangerous deals with infernal powers. These tales have proven true, and the Iron Kingdoms have recently been irrevocably changed by the Claiming, an attempt by these infernal creatures to take the payment they have long been owed—an unfathomable number of souls.
 Full. Metal. Fantasy. 
Delve into the award-winning world of the Iron Kingdoms with the latest edition of the Iron Kingdoms Role Playing Game from Privateer Press. Iron Kingdoms: Requiem combines this fantastic setting with the newest edition of the world’s most popular roleplaying game.
Inside this book you’ll find the history of the Iron Kingdoms and information describing the current state of the world following the Claiming. Alongside these chapters is an extensive gazetteer providing detailed information on the most notable of the world’s unique and fascinating locations.
When making a character, you’ll be able to choose from many of the familiar countries and cultures of the setting. Whether you want to be a human, gobber, trollkin, Rhulic dwarf, ogrun, Iosan, or Nyss elf, this book provides all the rules that make these different peoples unique. When choosing a class, there are options for many you’re already familiar with, from the stalwart man-at-arms fighter to the free-flowing monk of the Order of the Fist. Beyond these are brand new rules for playing the characters that make the Iron Kingdoms such a memorable setting. These new classes include, among others, gun mages, arcane mechanics, combat alchemists, and warcasters.
Alongside these options are new feats, spells, and backgrounds to make your characters feel even more a part of the world of the Iron Kingdoms.
Finally, within the pages of Iron Kingdoms: Requiem are extensive rules for the arcane technologies of the setting. These rules cover subjects from firearms and mechanika, like the galvanic arms and armor of the storm knight, to the mighty warjacks that accompany warcasters into battle.
"Before the Iron Kingdoms became a land dominated by industry and machines, it was the monsters that defined it."
— Professor Viktor Pendrake, author of the Monsternomicon 
In the Iron Kingdoms peril lurks at every turn, as fearsome and terrifying creatures both great and small look to turn unwary adventurers into their next meal or enslave them beyond death. From ferocious packs of ravenous burrow-mawgs to deadly ethereal pistol wraiths that haunt the back roads and forgotten cemeteries, and the fiendish Infernals that still stalk the shadows, the Monsternomicon is filled with creatures both mundane and supernatural to challenge even the most experienced adventuring parties.
This legendary tome includes over 80 monsters, new and old, steeped in over 20 years of worldbuilding, now appearing for the first time with 5th Edition rules.
Click to go to the Update featuring these two preview pages.
Discover the origins of the legend that started it all...
Twenty-one years ago, the Iron Kingdoms was introduced through an acclaimed series of adventures known as The Witchfire Trilogy. Now, the legend continues in the newest edition of the Iron Kingdoms RPG, written for 5e.
A girl, a sword, and a secret...
As a child, she lost everything when her mother was wrongfully executed for witchcraft and her soul was consumed by the most ancient of all weapons, the black blade known as the Witchfire. Hellbent to spare her mother an eternity of torture, Alexia Ciannor stole the accursed sword and set out to unlock its dark secrets. With the voices of the Witchfire's imprisoned souls raging in her mind, Alexia would eventually unlock the power of the Infernal artifact and command an army of undead to vanquish the villains seeking to use the sword to once again subjugate the Iron Kingdoms.
Nearly two decades later, the veteran of countless wars, Alexia returns to Corvis, the City of Ghosts, in search of help from the malignant forces that seek the return of the coveted sword. The Witchfire's true purpose is finally revealed, and only the courage and sacrifice of a small group of unlikely heroes can save Alexia from the brink of madness and prevent the infernal weapon from fulfilling its apocalyptic legacy.
The Legend of the Witchfire adventure will take players from level 1 to level 4, and is the perfect introduction to the action-packed and intrigue-filled world of the Iron Kingdoms!

We have a treasure trove of stretch goals planned for the Iron Kingdoms: Requiem campaign. They come in four different varieties:

More stretch goals will be revealed as earlier goals are unlocked during the course of the campaign!


MINIATURES ADD-ONS
Privateer Press is well known for miniatures, and we have thousands of them in our catalog, many of which would make fantastic RPG character and monster models for Iron Kingdoms: Requiem. In fact, we have so many that we wouldn't have enough space on this page to feature them all. Instead, we're going to curate a selection of miniatures relevant to Iron Kingdoms Requiem, which we'll make available in the post-campaign pledge manager with special Backer-only pricing. Watch for a forthcoming update soon that will list all of the miniatures that we'll be featuring in the line, and let us know if we missed one that you think should be included.

SHIPPING 
The European Union, UK, U.S.A., Canada, and Australia will be “Shipping Friendly.” Backers from these countries will not pay import taxes.
Shipping will be charged after the Kickstarter has completed based on actual costs to ship the rewards. We will collect your shipping information through our pledge manager once the campaign ends.

REFUND POLICY
Our refund policy aims to be as simple as possible—no questions asked. But there are some things you need to know.
Any pledge can be refunded in full up to 14 days after the Kickstarter campaign has come to a close.
For refund requests made more than 14 days after the Kickstarter, we will only be able to refund 85% of the pledged amount. The 15% that cannot be refunded are the irrecoverable fees collected by Kickstarter, our credit card processing company, and our pledge manager for processing your order.
During the course of our production of your rewards, we will make updates announcing pending shipping dates. Once we have begun packing and shipping orders, we will no longer be able to process refund requests.
If for any reason we are unable to deliver any part of your order, we will refund the pledged amount for this item in full, regardless of the date.
TERMS AND CONDITIONS
By pledging to this project, you acknowledge and agree to the following:
The rewards being created for this project are a “work-in-progress,” and the appearance, content, and materials of the rewards shipped are subject to change and may differ from what is shown or described during the Kickstarter project.
You are obligated to finalize your pledge and pay any shipping fees due by the closing date of the pledge manager. If you do not, then you may not receive your rewards by the expected delivery date, nor will you be entitled to a refund. We may, at our discretion and at the availability of the rewards, ship your pledge if you contact us and confirm your pledge after the pledge manager has closed.
Once you have confirmed your pledge in the pledge manager, our obligation is to ship your order as you have entered into the pledge manager system. Title and risk transfers to you once Privateer Press or our international fulfillment partners have delivered your rewards to a common carrier for shipment. With the exception of countries labeled as “friendly” in our shipping section, you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities. It is your obligation to provide accurate and correct address information and ensure that the address we ship to is deliverable by normal methods. Unfortunately, we cannot deliver to P.O. boxes.
Rewards returned as “Undeliverable” will be held, and you will be contacted via email to inform you of the return. At our discretion, we may require additional shipping payment if the reward must be reshipped.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Iron Kingdoms: Requiem is the seventh project we have brought to Kickstarter. Through our Kickstarter experience, we have learned a number of lessons, most important of all that allowing “scope creep” to occur over the course of the campaign leads to extended timelines and threatens the expected delivery dates. For Iron Kingdoms: Requiem, timely delivery of the rewards is absolutely essential for our planned release schedule, and as such, we will not waver from the goals of the project we have presented, nor can we add to what we have planned to deliver. 

Our very first product was a d20 OGL adventure, published 21 years ago. We've been making award-winning products ever since, with new products releasing every month for over two decades. We are experienced publishers with a history of timely delivery.

With that said, stuff happens. No one has escaped being affected by the COVID-19 and there's no way to tell yet how the coming year will unfold. But we have built in allowances for potential delays in our schedule, and we are prepared to do whatever we need to in order to deliver your rewards as close to our expected dates as possible. 

Beyond unexpected cosmic forces, our biggest risk is in working with outside vendors where issues beyond our control can occur. However, the vendor we are working with to produce all of Iron Kingdoms: Requiem rewards is someone we have a long history with and who has delivered top-quality products reliably for us for many years. It is always possible a ship breaks or something gets stuck in Customs, though, and this can cause delays. And we are all bracing for what lies ahead in the coming months with the coronavirus, which, of course, caused delays for countless products in production last year. But we will be in close contact with our vendor and we will always keep you updated if any delays occur, with as much notice as possible. 

Because we have endured a variety of setbacks due to external events as well as internal issues, we know there is always a risk of hitting the expected deadline. But in the end, we have always delivered close to our anticipated dates, so our largest risk is simply the delivery timing. After making sure we get you the best quality product and game experience, an on-time delivery is our highest priority and is, in our minds, essential to the success of this project.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Greeting Adventurers!
We are pleased to announce that the final updated PDFs for the Iron Kingdoms: Requiem Core Book, the Monsternomicon, and the Legend of the Witchfire Adventure are now available to download.

You can either await the email from Backerkit with the direct link to your digital downloads, or log in to your Backerkit account, head to digital downloads and start downloading right now.

Greetings Adventurers!
A few issues popped up upon release of the book PDFs yesterday and we want to let you know that we're on the case!
First, the  grenade stat error as well as the Agile Essence stat error will both be fixed in the final print product. Once we receive proofs of the book from our printer, we’ll be able to swap out the pages with correct versions.
Regarding the digital bookmarks, this is an issue that snuck past us because they weren’t actually supposed to be active. Somehow they were activated, but were never organized, which is why they are a mess. We’re going to go back to the files and correct the book marks so that they work properly, and then we’ll re-distribute an updated PDF file. This is likely to take a couple of weeks and we’ll update you once the files are ready to download again.

Greetings Adventurers!
It’s Download Day!
At this very moment thousands of emails are going out from Backerkit to your inbox with the links to down load the final PDF files of the Iron Kingdoms: Requiem Core Book, the Monsternomicon, and the Legend of the Witchfire adventure. As well, you’ll find in your available digital downloads in Backerkit the Iron Kingdoms poster map, digital PDF files of the Spell Cards and Warjack/Mechanika cards, as well as PNG files of the Battlegrid tiles if you pledge for any of these items in physical or digital form.

Greetings Adventurers!
We’ve got a mighty update for you today loaded with previews, progress reports and information about the future of Iron Kingdoms: Requiem. But first, a quick announcement about our next Kickstarter project, Riot Quest: Chilly Con Carnage, launching this coming Tuesday!

Greetings Adventurers! 

You know what's great? All the amazing feedback on our books we've been getting from you, the community! I know that sounds like I'm being sarcastic, but we really do appreciate it! 
One of the things we've been doing is taking the errors, typos and all that that you've been noticing in the comments, and forwarding them along to our team of editors, designers and layout artists. But, as you can tell, that can be a bit time consuming - so we've just created the brand new email address . This email is going to act as a repository for all the errors, typos and mistakes that you find, and make it so that our team can easily find, categorize, and fix the issue that you tell us about!

Greetings Adventurers! 
One of the things we've really started to do here at PPHQ is embrace the 5e community, and all the great things they're doing! We've come across a project that's in it's final 24 hours we think you should take a look at! It's called the Encyclopedia!

www.ConflictGames.com
Sometimes, it only takes one distinct characteristic for a monster to stick in our memories forever.
Sometimes, it’s the nuances in a battle that makes a strike so beautifully epic.
Sometimes, it's the monster’s crazed, desperate last moments that cause others to shudder.

MONSTER DESCRIPTION CARDS HELP YOU CRAFT UNFORGETTABLE MONSTERS AND THEIR EVENTS FROM START TO BITTER END! 
Monster Description Cards are extensive storytelling tools containing purposely unique flavor text to add realism or memorable characterization to creatures and their subsequent events. These cards provide keywords to spark your imagination and example phrases for their use. Written by novelists and organized by dungeon-masters, the cards are designed for quick on-the-fly use and inherently add randomization. The list of monster parts uniquely depicted include, but are not limited to, the following:
 Horns
   Teeth
   Claws
   Protrusions
   Bodily Forms (Hides, Ears, Eyes, etc.)
   Tails
   Wings
   Tentacles 
Between great heroes and great monsters lies the pinnacle of drama — Combat. The unrelenting tension that comes with knowing blood will be spilled, and life may be lost. Monster Description Cards will guide you while you detail these moments, providing keywords and examples for horns that PIERCE, claws that SLASH, tails that BLUDGEON, and more. Hundreds of new ways to describe monster strikes in these familiar categories: 
Slashing
Piercing
Blunt

What happens when a monster is cornered, heavily injured, or both? What if the creature is smart enough to be deceitful, spiteful, or vindictive in its last moments? How can you subtly share that your monster is on its last legs, but there is still a worrisome hint of malice in their eyes? These questions are all answered by the LAST STAND section of the cards. Where examples help illustrate the response of creatures facing overwhelming odds and perhaps displaying heroism, sacrifice, or wickedness of their own.


 “WRITERS OF ALL LEVELS LOVE THE IMPACTFUL NARRATIVE EXPERIENCES DESCRIPTION CARDS ADD TO THEIR WORKS” 
There are common composition principles that ask writers to "show and not tell ." That is, allow the reader to experience the story through actions, words, thoughts, senses, and feelings rather than through the author's summarization and cliches. The Monster Description Cards reinforces this principle by providing keywords to spark the imagination and elegant examples chock-full of distinctive story-building concepts.
"Cliche Busting Cards"
There are three cliche busting writer's tools within the Monster Description Cards.

 1. Above all else, the "core descriptions" provide brilliant creature concepts. They share unique ways to introduce or explain distinct physical features to an audience. These "core descriptions" allow writers to stay far away from monsters, terms, phrases, or even ideas that are now unoriginal and thoroughly overused.
   2. The second tool in the deck is the Combat Sections. These areas focus on drawing an audience into the sheer violence of monstrous combat, exploring unsettling concepts like great height and length, great strength, even preternatural abilities. They touch on the tension that lingers with the threat of a hero's death. These cards collect these concepts and inherently randomize them for writers to literally draw inspiration.
   3. The LAST STAND is a fresh and new idea for our card tools. Whether you write horror, sci-fi, or fantasy fiction, your creatures and oddities will need to be compelling and memorable, particularly in their last moments. The LAST STAND helps by offering depictions of your monstrosities on the verge of defeat while adding a bit of doubt in the reader's mind with one last defiant moment.
  AS A STORYTELLER, HAVING A MEMORABLE ANTAGONIST IS A KEY INGREDIENT TO SUCCESS. SO JOIN US! WE BELIEVE YOU WILL LOVE THESE CARDS.
For GameMasters (In-game Play)
The cards will melt right into your game, and your players will think you are brilliant. They will provide idea after idea on improving monster encounters. But more importantly, they will also drive you to new, full-blown campaign ideas. The type of campaign that players will reminisce about for years to come. The Monster Description Cards archive these feats by offering up concepts over statistical modeled stat-blocks. The cards narrate one-of-a-kind characteristics that you can easily add to existing monsters, creatures, or oddities. 

Introduce extraordinary creatures to your players, giving them clear signs of why they might be unique, even among their kin. 

Improve combat by focusing on the right adjectives associated with the body part landing the blow, such as claws, tails, or fangs. Not only are there specific narrations for specific body parts, but they are also broken down by blunt strikes, slashing strikes, and piercing strikes. With these multiple combinations, you can keep your combat fresh game after game. 

Lastly, there are always moments in the game where a GM would like to subtly provide hope to their players by indicating the monster is nearing defeat. These epic final moments are depicted in the LAST STAND sections of the Monster Description Cards.
Writing advice on worldbuilding typically leads towards lists of 'rules' and 'tips' which are either too general to be useful or downright wrong. The Monster Description Cards instead provide concepts and implementations of ideas capable of driving your imagination to discoveries about the world you want to create. Alongside the Magic Description Cards, the Monster Description Cards can immerse you in creative ideas and concepts that are anything but cliché.

IF YOU'RE A GM, THIS IS AN EASY BUY, BUY, BUY DECISION.

Familiars and Animal Companions: Your Familiars and Animal Companions are cool as hell. Let me make them sound cool as hell. Select a few cards that match the combat style of your familiar or animal companion and hand them to the Gamemaster to describe their attacks with style. Critical hits made by your Familiars or Animal Companion should be magnificent, and these cards provide that strike description that can be so satisfying. You can even have a LAST STAND card ready for your Familiars or Animal Companion just if things come down to that. Moreover, the cards' descriptions can be the basis of the unique features that make your Familiar or Animal Companion distinctively yours. So let’s build something special with these cards.

Shapeshifting: In tabletop RPGs, there are thousands of classes/powers/feats/spells that can shapeshift or grow body parts into lethal weapons. Thousands more transform hands to claws, teeth to fangs, arms to tentacles or growing tails, bony protrusions, even wings. Each of these wonderful transformations can benefit from the Monster Description Cards. The Cards will instantly make these transforms unique and unforgettable with clever depictions, separating your character's ability from the crowd of other characters with similar capabilities or sometimes the exact same class ability, power, feats, or spells.

Using the cards to depict transform spells: Using the Monster description cards to verbally illustrate the results of magical effects that modify a character's body is more than just a way to be unique; it's how you build a legacy. Stylize your character's abilities with these cards, so they are recognized by others, respected, or even feared.

Monster Journal Entries: Commemorate the monsters you've encountered by inserting Monster Description Cards in your monster journal. Flip through cards of unique descriptions to depict the memorable battles along your character's journey. Each card is your personal trophy, a memento of your battle-scars from the most challenging encounters. You can even use these cards to log essential information about certain monsters in your campaign, making every entry a result of your character's meticulous observations during battle. Sing the song better than any bard could with these encounter-defining descriptions. 
Build a strong visual library with the entire series of description cards from Conflict Games. The entire Description Cards line can be used as a database for ideas, concepts, events, environments, and fight scenes. Not only do these cards bring new ideas to concept art, but the combat styles and descriptions therein can help portray your creation in a way that works and sells a room on the idea.

During the Concept art process, Game Design, and Film writing, an artist and designer often craft creative assets like anomalies, monsters, characters, and fight scenes that heavily influence the final work. Our Descriptions Cards have been used during this process for great success. If the goal is to provide realistically visualize ideas for VFX teams, animators, and modelers, then the Magic, Combat, and now Monster Description Cards can be an innovative way to help and become key part of your process.
Unlike our previous description cards, these cards are double-sided and chock-full of goodness.
Backers will receive: 
200+ Descriptions and introductions of various monster components
  300+ Combat descriptions sorted by monster appendage
  100+ “Last Stand” descriptions, for portraying monsters that are heavily damaged vengeful, desperate, or relentless
  Printed on heavy card stock (350 gms)
  Large Format Card (tarot sized cards)
 
Size: 2.75'' x 4.75'' (70mm x 120mm)
  Over 100 total cards, including stretch goals
Each card is organized under the following general categories:
 Horns & Frills—Horns are hard permanent outgrowths, often curved and pointed and typically found in pairs. Frills are upward-curving bony plates typically extending behind the skull.

 Fangs & Maws —The Fangs category is considered the mouths, jaws, teeth, and maws of large, small, or odd creatures.
   Claws & Pincers—The claws category consists of pincers, paws, talons, and hooks. That is, any style of sharp, usually slender, and curved nail at the end of hands and feet.
   Protrusions & Osteoderms—This category consists of bony deposits that form knots above scales. Protrusions regularly produce sharp structures that can be used offensively, or widen scales and plates that add to the defenses of a monster.
 Bodily Forms—Creature hides, eyes, noses, ears, or other physical oddities that might distinguish a creature from its nightmarish kin are the focus of this group.
   Tails—The hindmost part of a monster, such as the flexible extension of the backbone in a vertebrate. Tails can be used to whip, constrict, or trip an opponent.
   Wings—This category focuses on wings of all shapes and sizes, functional or non-functional: Elliptical wings, high-speed wings, long soaring wings, and more. For the cards combat backside, wings will batter with winds, slice with sharp edges, and stab with spiked ends for a unique description style.
   Tentacles—The tentacles cards help depict any elongated, boneless, flexible organs, limbs, antenna, or barbels of famed monsters.
Potentially more to come with stretch goals, so please back and share this project.

One the backside of the cards are Combat Description for the associating Monster part. The cards are divided into three suits, which correspond to the three common attack types of Blunt, Slashing, and Piercing.
 

We understand that there are a multitude of genres, points-of-views, worlds, rulesets, and games that writers and tabletop gamers choose. That’s why our writing philosophy dictates the following rules which will ensure our content is system-agnosit, narrative Neutral and friendly to writers at all levels of expertise:
 We don’t describe the person perceiving the monster.
   We don’t give names to monsters.
   We don’t mention blood specifically, but generalizations like “fluid” are occasionally used .
   We don’t describe the surface the monster is on.
   Nothing cheesy, corny, or racy will be accepted.
   Both Heroes and Antagonists should be cool, so let’s make them sound cool!
  System Neutral: The card descriptions are not tied to any tabletop ruleset or Genre, meaning they can be used to describe monsters in any of your favorite tabletop-rpgs. If you run multiple games in multiple systems, these cards are great to use in any and all of your games.
The cards will help you answer question like these:
In a sea of zombies, what if you need one to stand out?
  In a world of dragons what makes this dragon different? Special? Memorable?
Anime is all about unique characters and ability, so why not use the cards to create singularity among a crowded field?

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All projects carry some risk. Fortunately, this is our 5th Kickstarter under the Conflict Games LLC brand and we have consulted on over 20 others. The Monster Description Card Deck is a fairly straightforward product. However, the foreseen risks involved include shipping logistics and the unexpected cancellation of contracted artists, writers, editors or product manufacturers. In the case of contract cancellation, the contractor will need to be replaced. Which in turn, could delay the project's completion but shouldn’t prevent its completion. 

In regard to shipping, logistics could become burdensome. We are unable to control the fact that domestic and out-of-the-US shipping costs seem to be spiraling out of control. However with our target funding goal, we don't foresee this preventing the project from succeeding; although, it may impact delivery dates. 

The one guarantee we can make is that we will be transparent with issues and communicate them to our backers as quickly as we can. We strongly believe our target funding goal is sufficient to complete our vision for the product. 

If you're as excited about this card deck as we are, then help us exceed that goal - we have much more we wish to do for this card series. This is just the first step in an exciting journey so please JOIN US!

updates.update_userinfo: May Project Update: We are Content Complete!
updates.update_content:
Hey Backers,

CONTENT COMPLETE
Our writing team created over 3,000 different variations of monster descriptions, 880 of which we have approved with flying colors and therefore for production. However, some of the best descriptions are longer than others. This may be a problem for physical cards, but not for the digital products. Therefore, we will be doing another round of selection to ensure only the cream of the crop gets printed. At the same time, we did not want to shortchange you guys on the creative efforts because of trivial physical limitations. Therefore, we have also decided that all 880 descriptions will be published on the Digital products (i.e., API, app, and writer's grid). The physical cards are my favorite, but there is an advantage to digital. With the bulk of the writing work completed, we are now moving on to the project's subsequent two phases. Below is a quick breakdown of the timeline.

Hey Backer Family,
I wanted to provide an update on our schedule.  As you would imagine, there's good news and bad news. The bad news is the project is delayed by about three months. The reason why it is delayed is the good news. We are still writing and editing the Monster Description Cards content.  This part of the process should have been completed about 30-40 days ago. However, I have been extraordinarily particular about the descriptions that make the final cut. For that reason, our writing room has created a ton of descriptions, and to guarantee high-quality creativity, we also have many rejections, edits, and rewrites. Each of these steps has gone slower than I anticipated.  I may add writers to the project, but I believe the best solution to the delay is to simply keep writing. There is no substitute for hard work, so work hard we shall.

campaign.story:
PLAY

NINJA HIGH SCHOOL exploded on the indie comic scene in 1987 and was the   first original American manga series to make a big hit. Following the   adventures of Jeremy Feeple who is suddenly being chased by a ninja named Itchy-Koo and an alien princess named Asrial in the town of   Quagmire. Later his younger brother Ricky would pick up the mantel. For 175 issues it is one of the longest running OEL(Original English  Language) manga to exist and has  influenced many. So much so that fans  and readers began to submit  stories based on the NINJA HIGH SCHOOL  characters and story situations.  This lead the creator of NINJA HIGH  SCHOOL, BEN DUNN, to begin to  collect these stories into annuals or  YEARBOOKS. Thus began a 20 year  tradition.
Now for the first time ever, these stories are being collected in  what  will hopefully be a series to collect all the various stories that  take  place in the NINJA HIGH SCHOOL universe. Inside this collection are   the talents of many fans and readers. Some who have gone on to have   incredible comic careers.
This is a must for any NINJA HIGH SCHOOL or manga fan.
PLAY

campaign.story:
Death Goddess Izanami  is a sculpture based on Izanami-no-Mikoto, the creation goddess and deity of the underworld as chronicled in Shinto mythology. 
The bold designs of Axis Mundi Games and the neoclassical virtuosity of CA Sculpts have merged to bring forth a boutique product designed for the most demanding collectors.
Death Goddess Izanami is a model that focuses on emotions as no model in the industry has done before. The sad majesty and woeful glory of a tormented goddess, the divine terror and eternal anguish of the departed, mere phantasms of their former conscience... all brought to life by a sculpture devised to match the style and the strength of neoclassical statues as never dared before.
As a surprise for the campaign launch, Progenitor God Izanagi has arrived! Izanami's husband and brother has manifested in all his mighty, progenitor of the new generation of gods and ordainer of the universe.
The aim of this kickstarter is to produce a limited collector's run called the Fukashi Sekai Run 不可視世界. All models forming part of the Fukashi Sekai Run will be numbered and signed.






The models are designed to be incredibly detailed and we are pushing our efforts to bring every detail to the highest point of clarity that is humanly possible!
Death Goddess Izanami has been 3D printed by one of the best artisans in the EU in high quality resin to ensure it can be cast smoothly and in great detail.
*Mana photo depicts a 1:10 example to show what can be done with the STL file. The resin model you can gain as reward for backing is in 54mm scale.

Death Goddess Izanami is part of the Sankokushin: Five Sacrifices project, the upcoming board game developed by Axis Mundi Games. Death Goddess Izanami campaign inaugurates the Sankokushin resin line, named Fukashi Sekai 不可視世界 (Invisible World), that we intend to develop for years to come with more and more models.
Sankokushin: Five Sacrifices is a solo-cooperative campaign game set in a fictional version of medieval Japan planned for Kickstarter in 2021.
 Can the Death Goddess - Izanami/Progenitor God Izanagi model be used in the actual game?
                                                 Yes. Specifically, they can be used as alternate sculpts for other models that will appear in a game's expansion. So, there is no locked gameplay content in Death Goddess - Izanami campaign.

We have successfully fulfilled our previous three Kickstarter projects with the full satisfaction of our backers and no complaints about our policies or customer service.

From the time this campaign ends until we are packaging your rewards for shipment, we have a “no questions asked” refund policy. 

However, Kickstarter and payment processing fees will be deducted from the total refund amount. The refund will be issued within 14 days from the request via PayPal or reversed via Stripe to your credit card at our discretion. After packaging your rewards for shipment, no refunds are possible.

Unconfirmed pledges make it difficult for us to plan production and logistics. 
If you do not confirm your pledge within eight weeks of our notification via email to confirm your pledge, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received.

If you confirm your pledge within eight weeks of our notification via email, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods.
